alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 04 at 3:59AM CDT until April 04 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Dangerous Fire Weather Conditions Still Expected This Afternoon Into Early Evening... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR NORTH CENTRAL KANSAS AND SOUTH CENTRAL NEBRASKA AREAS MAINLY SOUTH OF A GENEVA TO ALMA LINE... * WINDS...For southern parts of the Kansas warning area, a surge of strong southwest winds could arrive mid-to-late afternoon, sustained at least 25 to 35 MPH, and gusting 40 to 50 MPH, before wind direction abruptly shifts to out of the north- northwest behind a cold front. However, for the majority of the warning area, winds will likely prevail from the north to northwest throughout the afternoon and evening, increasing to sustained 20 to 30 MPH and gusting to at least 40 MPH by late afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 to 25 percent for a few to several hours, with the overall-lowest values focused within Kansas areas. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly. Use caution if engaging in activities that could result in fire ignition.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith
